item.description:
Updated on 8/22/2010:
Here is Baxter State Park web page to make a reservation for your car's Parking Lot if you visit state park on the day of the hike without camping.



I'm planning to visit Maine for multiple day hikes. Let's hike to several High Peaks in Maine together!!
The mountains which I highlighted in red are listed in NE 4K footers and in blue are listed as NE HH (New England 100 Highest).

This is cross posted event from my own hiking meetup - Hike/Snowshoe Vermont Meetup.



This is Day-3 hiking event description to peakbag 2 particular High Peaks: Hamlin Peak (4756 ft), Baxter Peak (5267 ft) (and Pamola (4919 ft)) at Mt Kathadin. I think there is no need to describe famous Mt. Kathadin, which is the highest peak in Maine. This is strenuous hike!
You can join us only one of my Maine hiking events or all which is up to you.

Hiking Plan:

1) This is round trip hike which doesn't require car spot.
We'll meet at the parking lot of Chimney Pond Tr trailhead in Baxter State Park at 6:00AM. and start hiking at 6:15AM sharp.

2) Here is my brief plan to take multiple trails to grab 3 peaks.

* Chimney Pond Trail, 2.3 mi (1 Hr 30 min)
* North Basin Cutoff , 3.0 mi (2 Hr 25 min)
* North Basin Tr, 3.3 mi (2 Hr 35 min)
* Hamlin Peak via Hamlin Ridge Tr, 4.6 mi (4 Hr 45 min)
* Caribou Spring, 4.8 mi (4 Hr 55 min)
* Saddle & Saddle Trail Junction via Northwest Basin Tr, 5.7 mi (5 Hr 20 min)
* Cathedral Trail Junc via Saddle Tr, 6.5 mi (5 Hr 50 min)
* Baxter Peak, 6.7 mi (6 Hr 10 min)
* Roaring Brook Campground via Pamola, the Knife Edge and Helon Taylor Tr, 11 mi (9 Hr 20 min)
Note: distance is cumulative mileage and inside paranthesis is cumulative book time.



Hiking Level:
Moderate
Hiking Distance: Approx. 11 miles
Hiking Pace: Slow to Moderate
Hiking Hours: 9.5 hours + Lunch 30min + Break Time (Of course, hiking hours varies depending on your hiking pace)



Suggested Meetup Locations:

1) We'll meet at the parking lot of Chimney Pond Tr trailhead at 6AM (= Roaring Brook Campground parking lot) in Baxter State Park.

2) I booked motel for 9/10 night stay at Kathadin Inn & Suites in Millinocket, ME. We can possibly meet at this Motel's Parking Lot at 5AM before entering the State Park for carpool if anyone preferred.

Kathadin Inn & Suites
740 Central Street
Millinocket, ME 04462
Toll Free: 877-902-4555
Phone: 207-723-4555
Fax: 207-723-6480
http://katahdininnand...

This is Google Map from Kathadin Inn & Suites in Millinocket, Maine to the trailhead.



It is obvious if you've done enough research regarding Mt Kathadin and Baxter State Park, but, here are some useful information for you just in case:

1) In Baxter State Park, you'll get water from brook or river only. It means you'll need water filter or something in order to drink it. I recommend you bring enough water before you get into the park if you don't have water filter or some other treatment stuff.

2) Chimney Pond Trail starts from Roaring Brook Campground. If you'd like to stay there, please book sites by yourself ASAP. Currently, mail-in reservation is available at Roaring Brook campsite.(as of 8/11/2010)



If you have any questions, please feel free to drop me an email.


Event Organizer,
Tomoko Nakajima
item.name: Multiple Day-Hiking Events in Maine - Day 3: Two High Peaks at Mt Kathadin
